articles.title: 'Why Fletcher could be what Man Utd fans have been waiting for'
articles.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why Manchester United's interim manager Darren Fletcher would be the perfect choice to take the job on a longer-term basis.

articles.title: 'Nobody can get hold of him' - what happened to David Batty?
articles.summary: England midfielder David Batty vowed to have "nothing to do with the football industry" after retirement. As his former clubs Newcastle and Leeds prepare to meet, BBC Sport asks: What happened to him?

articles.title: 'Like basketball' - Soucek criticises 'joke' penalty
articles.summary: West Ham's Tomas Soucek says the Premier League has become "like basketball" after a "joke" decision to award Nottingham Forest a penalty.

articles.title: 'A moving moment' as Rosenior breaks barriers
articles.summary: Liam Rosenior's appointment as Chelsea manager is a "massive moment" for representation in the Premier League.

articles.title: Interim manager Fletcher sought Ferguson 'blessing'
articles.summary: Darren Fletcher says he sought the blessing of his old Manchester United boss Sir Alex Ferguson before taking interim charge at the Old Trafford club.

articles.title: West Ham relegation fight 'not over' - Nuno
articles.summary: West Ham manager Nuno Espirito Santo reflects on his side's defeat by Nottingham Forest, insisting their relegation fight is "not over" with the Hammers seven points adrift of safety.

articles.title: We had the mentality to get the job done - Dyche
articles.summary: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche was happy with the "grit and determination" his side showed to come from behind to beat relegation-threatened West Ham.

articles.summary:
Speaking in his last press conference as Strasbourg manager, Liam Rosenior says taking the job at Chelsea is the right move for his career.

articles.title: Man Utd hold talks with trio over caretaker role
articles.summary: Manchester United hold talks with former players Darren Fletcher, Michael Carrick and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer about becoming the club's caretaker manager.
